item.title: Bridge returned error 500! (18667)
item.content:encoded:
abolishicedenver - Instagram Bridge was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `Unable to find username in search result.`
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Instagram&context=Username&u=abolishicedenver&media_type=all&direct_links=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: *Follows in English* En las últimas semanas hemos visto...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

*Follows in English*

En las últimas semanas hemos visto múltiples propuestas de reforma migratoria, entonces, ¿qué significan?¡Qué significan estas propuestas para usted, nuestra comunidad y nuestro trabajo en el futuro! ¡Únase a COPA para hablar sobre las diversas propuestas de reforma migratoria! ¡Nos acompañará la oficina de abogados de Meyer para responder algunas preguntas y hablar sobre las cosas que debe hacer para prepararse! La reunion sera por the aplicación zoom. R...egístrese aquí de antemano para recibir el enlace ➡️ http://bit.ly/Reform2021

*Se proporcionará interpretación al español. Otros idiomas están disponibles a pedido.

In the last couple of weeks we have seen multiple immigration reform proposals, so what do they all mean? What do these proposals mean for you, our community and our work moving forward! Join COPA to talk through the various proposals for immigration reform! We will be joined by the Meyer Law Office to answer some questions and talk about the things you should be doing to prepare! This meeting will be via zoom. Register here before hand to receive the link ➡️ http://bit.ly/Reform2021

*Spanish interpretation will be provided. Other languages are available upon request

See More

SAT, FEB 13 AT 1:00 PM MST

Propuestas de la Reforma Migratoria & Nuestra Comunidad/Immigrant Reform Bills & Our Community

Online Event40 people interested
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: ***Sigue en español*** On February 4th, newly-elected Senator...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

***Sigue en español***

On February 4th, newly-elected Senator John Hickenlooper voted alongside Republicans in favor of an amendment that would deny undocumented immigrants access to federal COVID relief. His vote was for a non-binding amendment, one of hundreds that will guide the actual policy of the bill that will be voted on in the coming weeks. Before that vote happens, we must show Senator Hickenlooper that his stance is unacceptable. Coloradans want COVID relief for ev...eryone. Join us on Tuesday to demand that the senator support stimulus checks for every member of our community.
El 4 de febrero, el senador John Hickenlooper votó junto con los republicanos a favor de una enmienda que negaría a los inmigrantes indocumentados el acceso al alivio federal de COVID. Su voto fue a favor de una enmienda no vinculante, una de las cientos que guiarán la política real del proyecto de ley que se votarán en las próximas semanas. Antes de que ocurra esa votación, debemos mostrarle al senador Hickenlooper que su postura es inaceptable. Los habitantes de Colorado quieren un alivio de COVID para todos. Únete a nosotros el martes para exigir que el senador apoye los cheques de estímulo para cada miembro de nuestra comunidad.

See More

TUE, FEB 9 AT 4:00 PM MST

Car Rally for COVID Relief

2015 Stout St DenverCauses · 109 people
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "Prisoners at the St. Louis City Justice Center have been...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Prisoners at the St. Louis City Justice Center have been protesting since December for safe and humane conditions during the COVID pandemic. They have faced extremely serious retaliation including what appears to be intentional exposure to COVID-infected inmates.

The conditions they are rising up against are shared by prisoners and ICE detainees all across the country. We know full well that these conditions are present in Denver and across the state of Colorado.

Join us Wed...nesday at 5:30pm for a solidarity rally at the Denver City Jail where speakers will share words from inside the St. Louis City Justice Center and insights into the realities inside local jail and prison facilities.

We demand mass humanitarian release of prisoners, safe and humane conditions, and an end to retaliation against prisoners who speak out about abuses and unsafe conditions."

#FreeThemAll

See More

WED, FEB 10 AT 5:30 PM MST

Solidarity with St. Louis & All Prisoners! Rally at Denver City Jail

Denver Downtown City Jail

· Denver50 people interested
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Drop the charges and #justiceforelijahmcclain!
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Drop the charges and #justiceforelijahmcclain!

BreakThrough News

The only people charged over the brutal police murder of Elijah McClain are community activists who organized mass peaceful demonstrations calling for justice. ...They are facing up to 48 years in prison - among the highest charges for peaceful political protest in recent history.

#JusticeForElijahMcClain #DropTheChargesCO

item.title: This is the second death in ICE custody since Biden has taken...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

This is the second death in ICE custody since Biden has taken office. The call to #FreeThemAll and #AbolishICE has not gone away.

item.title: "Union del Barrio understands that deportations will not...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Union del Barrio understands that deportations will not stop because Trump is no longer president. We will continue utilizing our community patrols as a tool for fighting back against ICE raids in our San Diego communities. Our patrols have successfully documented and in some cases, halted ICE raids altogether. We will be sharing our thoughts and insight on our community patrols and giving info on how folks can get involved in protecting our people from Migra/police terrorism."

WED, FEB 17 AT 6:00 PM PST

Noche de Defensa y Resistencia: Melting ICE Union Del Barrio’s Community Patrols

Online EventCauses · 113 people

Solidarity with incarcerated workers fighting for their health, safety and lives.

"It was at least the third disturbance at the CJC in recent weeks. One occurred the last week of December and a second just days later. In those cases inmates had expressed concern about unsafe conditions amid the coronavirus pandemic."

Tear gas was used to regain control after inmates caused damage to the fourth floor of the City Justice Center on Saturday morning.

stltoday.com

Inmates jump guard, set fires, smash windows at downtown St. Louis jail

item.title: "The white conservatives aren’t friends of the Negro...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The white conservatives aren’t friends of the Negro either, but they at least don’t try to hide it. They are like wolves; they show their teeth in a snarl that keeps the Negro always aware of where he stands with them. But the white liberals are foxes, who also show their teeth to the Negro but pretend that they are smiling… One is the wolf, the other is a fox. No matter what, they’ll both eat you.” — Malcolm X

item.title: Call to Action! Stand with Sanctuary4All Colorado by calling on...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Call to Action!
Stand with Sanctuary4All Colorado by calling on Senator Hickenlooper to support immigrant communities!

This week, Senator Hickenlooper turned his back on the immigrant community in Colorado and around the country by supporting a move to block undocumented families from receiving COVID relief checks. While the vote was non-binding, he needs to hear from constituents that these decisions that hurt those most vulnerable to the pandemic will not be tolerated, bef...ore he does it again.

Sanctuary 4 All, a grassroots organization that advocates for the immigrant community in Colorado, has put out a call to action for Coloradans to voice their anger over Hickenlooper’s vote.

WHY: Coloradans elected Senator Hickenlooper to support everyone, regardless of their legal status. He needs to know that this is an unacceptable position to take and that we will hold him accountable.

HOW: Call Senator Hickenlooper today at 202-224-5941 to let him know that everyone deserves relief from the COVID-19 pandemic and that his actions matter to the people of Colorado.

SAMPLE SCRIPT:
My name is [FULL NAME] and I live in [COMMUNITY/ZIP CODE].
I am calling because I am deeply disturbed by Senator Hickenlooper’s vote to block undocumented families from receiving COVID relief checks. Everyone in Colorado and around the country deserves support during this pandemic, especially immigrant communities that can be even more vulnerable. As his constituent, I will continue to hold Hickenlooper accountable for all of his votes and demand that he support immigrant families.

GOAL: DSURJ’s goal is to generate at least 20 calls by the end of the weekend to send a clear message to Hickenlooper that we are watching each and every one of his votes.

Comment below to let us know you've reached out and please share!

See More

item.title: El Congresista Joe Neguse le invita a participar en una sesión...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

El Congresista Joe Neguse le invita a participar en una sesión informativa virtual y bilingüe para hablar sobre las recientes órdenes ejecutivas sobre inmigración que firmó el presidente Joe Biden, así como nuevas propuestas de ley en el Congreso.

Esta sesión informativa se llevará a cabo en español y inglés con interpretación a los dos.

Panelistas:

...

• Rep. Joe Neguse, Congreso de los Estados Unidos
• Violeta R. Chapin, Profesora de Derecho, Escuela de Derecho de la Universidad de Colorado

• Marisa Molina, Directora Estatal para Colorado, fwd.us

• Jorge Loweree, Consejo Americano de Inmigración

• Johanna Ulloa, Biblioteca Pública de Poudre River/Consejo Asesor Latino del Rep. Neguse

Registrarse Aqui: neguse2021.com

Asegúrese de tener actualizada la última versión de Zoom para poder acceder a la función de interpretación. Y si planea unirse por teléfono, deberá usar la aplicación Zoom.

---

Congressman Joe Neguse invites you to join him for a bilingual town hall to discuss President Biden's recent executive orders on immigration, as well as proposed legislation.

This virtual event will be hosted in Spanish and English with interpretation for both languages.

Panelists:

• U.S. Congressman Joe Neguse

• Violeta R. Chapin, Clinical Professor of Law, University of Colorado Law School

• Marissa Molina, Colorado State Director, fwd.us

• Jorge Loweree, American Immigration Council

• Johanna Ulloa, Poudre River Public Library/Rep. Neguse Latino Advisory Council

Register here: neguse2021.com

Please make sure you have the latest version of Zoom updated, so that you can access the interpretation feature. And if you plan to join by phone, you will need to use the Zoom app.

See More

FRI, FEB 5

Bilingual Immigration Town Hall

Online EventCauses · 341 people

item.title: Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Emergency call Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad journey in his role by giving his back to the immigrant community. By voting no on COVID relief checks for immigrant families that have no sort of economic support from our government. Clearly he does not care now that he has a home, he has food, he has medical insurance, a secure salary that his citizens pay including tax paying immigrants. His decisions harm a large number of people in Colorado and that is unaccept...able. Call his office in Washington and let him know that his decision was one of the biggest mistakes he could’ve made. 202-224-5941. We hope that he supports all his citizens in Colorado but also at a national level regardless of their legal status. The immigrant community in this pandemic is the most vulnerable in not being able to receive federal aid. Call and ask your acquaintances to show their indignation and anger upon this decision.

See More
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad journey in his role...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Today Senator Hickenlooper has started a bad journey in his role by giving his back to the immigrant community. By voting no on COVID relief checks for immigrant families that have no sort of economic support from our government. Clearly he does not care now that he has a home, he has food, he has medical insurance, a secure salary that his citizens pay including tax paying immigrants. His decisions harm a large number of people in Colorado and that is unacceptable. Call his ...office in Washington and let him know that his decision was one of the biggest mistakes he could’ve made. 202-224-5941. We hope that he supports all his citizens in Colorado but also at a national level regardless of their legal status. The immigrant community in this pandemic is the most vulnerable in not being able to receive federal aid. Call and ask your acquaintances to show their indignation and anger upon this decision.
